concise_definition: n. 冠军, 英雄; v. 咀嚼, 咬碎

definitions.explanation_en: A person who has won a championship or is regarded as the best in a particular field, often celebrated for skill, determination, or dominance.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在某一领域赢得冠军头衔或被视为最优秀的人，常因其技能、决心或统治力而受到赞誉。
definitions.example_en: Muhammad Ali was a champ in the boxing ring and a symbol of resilience.
definitions.example_cn: 穆罕默德·阿里是拳击场上的冠军，也是坚韧不拔的象征。

definitions.explanation_en: Informal term for a person who is admired or looked up to, often used affectionately or ironically.
definitions.explanation_cn: 非正式用语，指受人钦佩或仰慕的人，常带有亲切或讽刺的语气。
definitions.example_en: You're my champ for finishing that project on time!
definitions.example_cn: 你按时完成那个项目，真是我的英雄！

definitions.explanation_en: To chew or grind something with the teeth, often noisily or repeatedly, especially when anxious, impatient, or distracted.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用牙齿咀嚼或咬碎某物，常发出声响或反复进行，尤其在焦虑、不耐烦或分心时。
definitions.example_en: He was champing at the bit, eager to start the race.
definitions.example_cn: 他急得直咬牙，迫不及待想开始比赛。

definitions.explanation_en: To show impatience or restlessness, especially by biting or gnawing at something (often used in the phrase 'champ at the bit').
definitions.explanation_cn: 表现出不耐烦或焦躁不安，常通过咬或啃某物来体现（常用于短语 'champ at the bit'）。
definitions.example_en: The team was champing at the bit to launch the new product.
definitions.example_cn: 团队急不可耐地想推出新产品。

comparison.analysis: “Champion” (冠军/拥护者) 是更正式、更广泛使用的词，既可指体育比赛的获胜者，也可指为某事业或人辩护的拥护者。而 “champ” 是其非正式、口语化的缩略形式，语气更轻松甚至带点亲昵或调侃。
“Hero” (英雄) 强调道德勇气、牺牲精神或对社会的积极影响，常带有崇高色彩；而 “champ” 更侧重于在竞争中获胜或表现出色，不一定涉及道德层面。在口语中，“champ” 可用于日常称赞，而 “hero” 更具情感重量。
“Gnaw” (啃咬) 指持续、缓慢地咬，常用于动物或因焦虑而咬物，强调动作的持久性和破坏性；而 “champ” 更强调快速、有节奏、有时是无意识的咀嚼，常伴随情绪（如急躁），且多用于短语 'champ at the bit'，具有比喻意义。
